reviews.title: Traveler Beware
reviews.text: March 2006
Hotel Riu Palace Macao in Punta Cana , Dominican Republic.
reviews.title: Very satisfied

reviews.text: My partner and I just got back from a 6 night stay at the Hotel Riu Palace Macao in Punta Cana. Upon arrival the hotel is beautiful and the staff was very friendly. We had a beautiful room – Room 3340 on the top floor. The first three nights we had no air conditioning, this was eventually fixed. The next day in a half there was no hot water or water pressure. I asked what the problem was at the desk. The receptionist explained that they are building a new Riu hotel and are transferring the water to that hotel. I asked what about the people here and he said it will only be for a little while. This lasted a day and a half. We made the best of our trip. The food was good and the beach is beautiful. Every morning we were out of our room by 8:30 and got a spot on the beach. On our last full day there, we decided to relax and get up a little later. I got up while my friend slept and went down to get beach towels at about 8:45. By the time I got back in a 15 -20 minute time frame, someone with a key went into our room while my friend was sleeping and took the jewelry which was left on the dresser. When I left, the door was locked and the “DO NOT DISTURB” sign was on the door knob. We immediately told the hotel manager who then came to the room with security and searched the room. Our safe was locked, the person who came into the room used a key and only took the jewelry on the dresser. The management questioned the hotel staff on our floor and they said they know nothing, how surprising is that! The management told us we have to go to the police station and make a report. After waiting two hours, the police said they could not make a report, because “a key” was used to get into the room and it was the hotel’s responsibility to take action. We got nowhere with the hotel, when we requested a report of what happened, the management kept wanted to give us a free 7-night stay at any of the Carribean Riu’s in a years time frame. It was like wheeling and dealing with a salesman to get the report. Everytime we asked for it, they want to give the trip, this paper also states that you are satisfied with how the hotel handled your inconvenience and that they are not held responsible for what happened if you take the 7-night stay. Finally after much hesitation from the manager he supplied us with a report of what happened. We have traveled to Punta Cana twice before and stayed at Iberostar Bavaro had a wonderful relaxing vacation. This trip started off good and wound up to be a nightmare. I would have never thought that by leaving the room with the “DO NOT DISTURB” sign and the door locked for such a short amount of time how your life changes. I how this makes people more aware when traveling.
reviews.title: Overal great time at the Riu Palace

reviews.text: My wife and I just returned (March 4) from a delightful two weeks at the Riu Palace. Our college children also joined us for one week.
reviews.title: Our Paradise On Earth
Worst Service EVER!
reviews.text: The facility is very CLEAN with staff constantly in the public areas cleaning though not noticebly necessary. Washroom attendants were very a constantly in the areas.

What an amazing resort! We went for a weeks trip from March 6-13th! We had a blast! The Punta Cana International Airport was so unique! The airport is completely open with a thatched roof. The departure area as well, lots of fresh air and is so different. Once off the plane you get a picture with two Dominican women which you can purchase for $10 canadian when you depart. Once you clear customs, you will have guys waiting to help you with your bags, they will want a small tip but a simple "no thanks" will work. The ride from the airport to the Riu Palace Macao was interesting! They drive all over the road and makes it a little tense but so worth it when you get there!
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!

reviews.text: The hotel- wow - what a beaut! The staff are amazing! Widny at the front desk was so helpful. There is a server at the pool named Antonito. He was the best! You will always hear him say "I love my job". The rooms were spacious, clean and cool. The mini bar was stocked daily. We noticed that most guests don't tip the staff. We did and they really appreciated it!
reviews.title: wonderful vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants were great. Kabuki, the japanese restaurant was our favorite besides the buffet. Make sure you go to the gala buffet. They have dishes from all the restaurants. The Caribe grill and the steakhouse were also great! They only accept reservations from 730am to 930am but we never had a problem getting in and never had to wait to make a reso. We overheard a couple staying at the Riu Palace that the line up to make resos everyday was insane. We never had a line to make a reso. We walked over to the Riu Palace, it looked nice, don't get me wrong but it felt cold and stuffy compared to the Riu Palace Macao.
reviews.title: RIU Palace Macao as advertised

reviews.text: There is a Caribbean Street right beside the Riu Palace Macao which had tons of shops. They have a Caribbean Festival on the Caribbean Street once a week with vendors on the street and you can barter prices. The prices in the store are fixed.
reviews.title: Great Time, Great Food, Great People
Paradise
reviews.text: We also never had a problem finding a chair at the beach or by the pool any time. You always have those who hold chairs all day, we didn't and we never had a problem finding it.

reviews.title: Very decent holiday
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a seven day holiday at Riu Palace Macao, Punta Cana week of January 14th, 2006 with my parents and infant daughter. To put in context, we tend to vacation once per year in south (e.g Cuba, DR, or Mexico). Was very satisfied with this hotel. Yes, when the brochures state 5 stars, we are not talking London, Paris, NYC or Toronto equivalents so let's rein in expectations which seem to skew other reviews I have read on this hotel.

1) Very good food. We enjoyed the variety of the buffet for breakfast and dinner. Snack bar for lunch was ok. Good theme nights which added to variety - handing out cigars to all guests, special cocktails, etc. Yes, you had to indicate whether you wanted to eat at 630pm or 830pm however there seemed to be flex within this. We thoroughly enjoyed the Caribe Grill (one of the non-buffet restaurants) for dinner one evening for more traditional "sit-down" dinner.
reviews.title: Major Letdown
Punta Cana is Beautiful!
reviews.text: 2) A/C...as other reviews note this is a slightly older, classical design hotel so the A/C does not cool your hotel room down in 5 minutes. However, we left our system on virtually all the time and found the interior room temp cool and pleasant. Actually, was nice to have a system which was totally silent. (Frankly, if it is that bad, there are ceiling fans which you can activate which we found made it too cool).

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.text: 3) Our room was well maintained and clean; no problems with the bathroom other than the odd temporary shortage of decent hot water. Well stocked mini-bar which was at our disposal as part of package. Me thinks you will be hard pressed to find that kind of amenity free of charge in any locale in N America; was nice to indulge without having to complete a mini-bar inventory sheet!

reviews.title: Very Satisfied
reviews.text: 4) Staff were really very friendly and helpful yet not over-bearing. We found the folks at reception accommodating particularly when we had requests relating to our infant.

reviews.text: had mixed feelings about going. I called our travel agent to ensure

My husband, daughter, and I just returned from the Riu Palace, and we loved it. The food was very good (buffet style), and you will surely find something you like (we had lobster one night). The 'two' restaurants you have to reserve (they're in the same place on opposite sides) was really not worth it. We got bit by mosquitoes, and the food was very average. Stay in the buffet!! There is one pool, and one kiddie pool. The beach was pretty disappointing. I went only one time in the ocean...it was dirty with seaweed everywhere; I don't know if it's because of the season or if it's always like that. It was also very wavy. The service is excellent. The staff incredible. The bedroom all mahogany wood everywhere. Beautiful. They will only upgrade you by one level (there are 4 levels). We booked a standard room (#1), and they automatically upgraded us to a #2, but refused to give us any better unless we paid...not even with bribes ($$$), because they could get it a lot of trouble. Great vacation. Look out for the animator 'Juan'...he wears tight red spandex shorts and is very obscene. Watch him do aerobics and get a good laugh.
reviews.title: Incredible Vacation
Great hotel
reviews.text: Hotel is 5 star, loved it and the staff is wonderful. Good food and drink.

reviews.title: Travel Update
reviews.text: The Europeans, who seem to be mostly German and French, come down here and turn up the sneer volume to eleven. I am sharing a hotel with them and they refuse even to look at me. I am a ghost to them, I do not exist. They do not know I am American, and it clearly is not personal. They are treating each other this way, too. But it takes great effort to be so antisocial. I do not understand how these people can be in such a warm and friendly place and go for days in a row without looking their fellow human beings in the eye. They are not a fraction as nice to the shopkeepers as I am. One of the merchants actually complained to me about how rude his previous French customers were. Life is too short - relax and enjoy yourselves, smile once in a while.

reviews.title: Water problem at first, but overall very nice
reviews.text: I am a Travel Agt, recently returned from Punta Cana after experiencing Tropical Storm Jeanne (which became a Hurricane 1 Cat briefly, before downgrading to Tropical Storm). My husband & I arrived Sept 13 to beautiful weather and everything as expected at our hotel, Riu Palace. By Weds the storm had hit and lasted approx 5 hrs. We were perfectly safe as this is a solidly built traditional hotel. Debris, trees and other damage was obvious, but the hotel suffered no severe structural damage. We had power outages, no phones,no TV, and computer down time. The hotel had emergency generator so food, drinks, lights etc. were available fairly soon and the staff did all they could to help. Room service was curtailed (no maid service for 2 days). The most common concern for guests was lack of "who is in charge?"(hotel management here was somewhat remiss in keeping everyone informed),....and lack of Tour Operator presence. As An Agt I can probably explain that most Tour Ops on duty are "local" people and very likely could not get in, plus they have to visit and coordinate with several resorts. Also, the roads outside the resort were flooded so no cars or vehicles could arrive safely. However, I am aware this explanation doesn't always help when you don't know what's going on!

After the worst of the storm passed (Thurs) we were able to walk the beach and checked out other properties beside the Riu properties - Iberostar Dominicana, Punta Cana and Iberostar Bavaro Suites. -- These properties suffered a lot of debris, broken trees etc and much flooding. Clean up was in progress, but of course it will take some time to get back to normal. The rain doesn't help! Overall comments at the resort were that the Staffs were doing all the could to help guests. But again, lack of Tour Op presence was a concern. Secrets Excellence resort suffered water damage and because of its location, guests were helicoptered out to the airport by Sat because of the flooded roads, for return to the USA. We had a Cleveland destination and were taken by tractor/trailer to the tour buses to dry land, and then bussed to the airport for flts out on Sat 18th Sept. As primitive as this sounds, I have to say that Staff/Tour Ops did what they could to make sure everyone was picked up safely and taken out. It is a point to remember that late Summer to end of November is Hurricane Season in the Caribbean and of course, risky for a vacation albeit a good price! We take our chances! I hope everyone involved this last week returned home safely and trust the situation is an experience learned. The Dom Republic does not have the infrastructure to cope with these situations as in the US. and I hope we give some consideration and appreciation to the people there who did all they could to help.
reviews.title: Could not ask for more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're a 50ish couple who were looking for a lovely place to rest and recharge for 14 days and we found it at the RIU Macao. We were upgraded to a 3rd floor pool view from the garden view.
reviews.title: Gotta love a RIU!

likes.liked: — food, clean, size of resort, beach and palm grove, nice service, piano bar

reviews.title: Beautiful Resort
reviews.text: We are extremely fussy about our food and the food was excellent. Always lots of yummy things to try. Too many to list! We did prefer the buffet to the specialty restaurants. Take the tour of the kitchens if you can. RIU's are justifiably proud of their operation.

reviews.title: Beautiful place!!!!
reviews.text: The room, which was a nice room but not a "wow" room, was kept very clean by our very nice maid. They were always scrubbing, gardening and tidying. The grounds are beautiful.

The beach was lovely, lots of chaises in both sun and in the amazing palm grove. It never felt crowded. If you want more than one towel, ask for another towel card at the main desk...they don't care how many you have, they just want to keep track of them.
reviews.title: If you don't like this one - stay home - travel is not for you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be sure to tip and take a moment to say hello...the people who work there really work hard on our behalf.
reviews.title: Great Getaway!
Best of the RIU's
reviews.text: It is hard to say more then has been already stated by others about this Hotel. It was a excellent experience for a group of six from Toronto area. We have visited sveral other destinations, including Mexico, Jamaica Cuba, and St Martin and this Hotel ranks equal or better then all the 5 stars in those areas. In comparison to the local Riu's I say this is the best and as we had visting privlidges I can say with confidence that the service level ( IE more staff per guest, pool waiter service, beach bar) is superior. The Beach section is the best on the strip as it has the widest shady section and widest open (near water) section of all.

We did walk in and around the new Palace and found it to feel more crowded and the pool was small and very crowded. I would gguess the service level would be top notch as it is a Palace. We had no complaints other than having to leave the plus 30 degree (no daytime rain all week) to go home to Toronto with minus 27 degrees deep freeze.
reviews.title: Great Trip to the RIU

reviews.text: Just returned from Riu Macao. This was my first all inclusive resort (other than a cruise). Well I really enjoyed it. The hotel itself is beautiful. The decor is classic european, very upscale. We booked a suite but at check in were upgraded to jacuzzi suite at no additional cost other than a tip for the guy at the front desk (which i think is why we were upgraded). The staff at this hotel work so incredibly hard, I was beyond impressed....The waiters and bartenders always remember what you drink, the housekeeping staff cleaned my room and replenshed the towels everyday without my seeing them. The shows at the hotel are not the greatest, but we were with a group of family and friends and just kind of went with the flow....
reviews.title: Phenominal as Always!

reviews.text: I was torn between staying at the Macao or the newer Palace, but glad I choose the Macao. The Palace is very luxurious, but very large. We stopped by to check it out, the pool area was sooooo crowded. The pool area at the Macao is much more spread out, with acres of palm trees between the pool and the beach.
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.text: I found the food to be quite good at the Macao. If people say that they got sick, surley it is because you eat too much food. I can attest to that.
reviews.title: Riu Palace Macau

reviews.text: I read the reviews some people wrote about this hotel and they must have been very hard to please. We found the hotel to be very clean and comfortable. The people there could not do enough for us.

reviews.text: We ate all the restaurants and the only one we did not care for was the oriental, it did not have a good varity on the menu and we are not interested in sushi (spelling ?).

The only thing they did not serve drinks on the beach so we had to get our own, but it was not very far and at least we got some excerise. They did have servers at the pool and they had daily activities there, you could join if you were so inclined.

likes.disliked: — Would like to be able to drink tap water.

reviews.title: The best trip ever
reviews.text: The beds were two queens pushed together, so they were plenty big.

Hi there, we just returned from the Riu Palace Macao about 3 days ago, and absolutely LOVED it. My parents, grandfather, 2 friends, and myself (we are college freshmen) went on this trip. After reading the reviews, I was a little nervous. We had actually booked our 2 rooms at the Riu Taino, but upon arrival we were upgraded to the Palace (still not sure why?)
reviews.title: Spring Break Paradise
RIU equals Paradise Macao
reviews.text: The grounds were beautiful, and the staff was amazing. Although it seemed like mostly middle-age to older clientele, me and my 2 girlfriends made friends with the Entertainment staff (Riu Animacion), who were mostly in their early 20's, and had just a good of time. I have absolutely no complaints.

reviews.title: loved it
reviews.text: I've been to the Riu Palace in Cabo San Lucas, and although Macao wasnt as brand new, it was just as wonderful. All of the other Riu hotels were within walking distance (we visited the pool at Naiboa one day, and always had lunch at Bambo).

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: The nightly bingo games are a blast if a man named JoJo is doing them, we laughed our butts off! The nightly shows are not too bad, Grease and Michael Jackson were pretty entertaining. The entertainment crew always had people up and dancing to the bands when they played. We went to the Disco a couple nights; it was ok, but they charged for drinks in there, and most people didn't go there til around midnite or later. The front desk was always glad to hold our key, and we could pick it up anytime. They also had no problems walking us up to the room and letting us in with the master key (seeing as how we were 3 teenage girls sharing one key, this was very helpful!)

reviews.title: Loved the Palace Macao
reviews.text: Henry at the front desk was very helpful and friendly, and as far as the entertainment crew, we all loved Wilkin, Alexis, DJ John, and Algenis. Although none of them spoke perfect english, they did their best to understand you, and we never found it a problem to hold a conversation. They seemed just as eager to learn and understand english as they are to teach you a few things in spanish! I can gladly say i came back with my Spanish vocabulary greatly expanded!

This was 4th trip to Riu Palace Macao and it was better than our fist visit. We left for the D.R. on July 13th after debating whether or not to cancel due to the impending arrival of Hurricane Emily. Fortunately, Emily went south and the weather was wonderful for the entire week. Hotel rooms have been refurbished and are absolutely spotless. I like to request a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor to avoid the "musty" smell that has been reported, but did have a first floor and there was no problem with odors at all. One night the maid had put sheets on the beds that were "nubby" and kind of painful, but we pulled them off and they were replaced with fresh ones the next day. Pillows were in need of replacement, but since there were about 6 in the room we had a selection. The food was varied and very good. We traveled with our 13 year old nephew who is (at best) an extremely picky eater and he was able to survive the week with no difficulty. (plenty of pizza, pasta, bread and ice cream) Against my better judgement, we ate at the Steak House restaurant expecting steaks to be the tough, caribbean meat you usually find. WRONG!! They were very good...We ate and drank everything and no one became ill at all. They sprayed the property every am (very early) for mosquitos. Bugs were not a problem at all. There was the occasional millipede in the hall, but that was no big deal. Alcohol was premium and plentiful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort!

reviews.text: THE BEACH is the best. Soft white sand, long, wide and full of palm trees for shade. Never a problem finding a beach chair. We've been to many many beaches, this is one of my favorites. The swimming pool is not huge, but very clean with continuous fountains. I personally hate swim up pool bars so it was a blessing not to have one. If someone feels that is necessary, just go to one of the nearby other Riu Hotels which do have swim up pool bars. We traveled with Apple Vacations out of Baltimore and they did a wonderful job as well. One word of caution....When departing from Punta Cana Airport make certain to check, re-check, and tripple check your departure gate as they change them without notice. It would be easy to miss your flight if you do not keep up to date.
reviews.title: Will not go back.
Our new home away from home
reviews.text: All in all, really great hotel and we will continue to return. Please feel free to email me if you have any questions or concerns.

reviews.title: We'll DEFINITELY return again!!!!! :)))
reviews.text: Just the facts. The beach was awesome. The sand was soft with clear blue calm water, after the hurricane passed. The service was excellent. The food was ok. We had to shoo the flys off the food at the buffet at some of the resturants. I did get very sick with food poisoning.

The resort was beautiful all in all. BUT, the rooms smelled like an old basement. We changed rooms right away the first day. Mold and mildew is growing on everything in and out of the room, including on the mattress. The beds were hard as rocks and the linens were falling apart. They felt like sand paper on your skin. My fiance and I suffered from back pain all five nights. Our plan was a nice relaxing vacation, not the case. The pool was smaller than expected but refreshing. The entertainment was fun and upbeat. We did not go to the disco at night but it was large and airconditioned. I was happy to come back home to the US. I will not go back to the Dominican Republic.
reviews.title: Cannot wait to get back to the Riu Palace
Great Resort, Great Service, Great Beach!
reviews.text: We were in paradise the moment we got there! We got into our room earlier than we were supposed to. The room overlooked the pool, however I didn't care if it would have looked over the grounds, because the whole resort was beautiful, plus you aren't in your room that much anyway. The rooms were very clean! The staff at the resort go out of there way to make your stay as comfortable, relaxing and as fun as possible! They work very hard, so make sure you tip, if your too cheap to tip, then don't expect to get the service like the people that do! We thought the food was very good, and we are very picky when it comes to the quality of our dining. The beach is absolutely beautiful. We walked up and down the beach and Rui has the best beach! We are looking forward to our next stay! Rui Hotels should be proud of the staff at Rui Palace Macao!

reviews.title: Pros and Cons of my Recent 7 day visit
reviews.text: I just returned from the Riu Palace and would like to share some of my experiences. The positive things I observed were the incredible service and friendliness of the staff, the cleanliness of the entire facility, having lunch at the Caribe Grill right next to the ocean, and a buffet that I was satisfied with in the main restaurant. I could always find plenty of things that were delicious. Another great thing is Thursday night on Carribean Street. I also loved the stretching class on the beach and the water aerobics class in the pool each day. The piano bar right next to the buffet has very nice entertainment before and after dinner on most nights.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Now for some negatives from my point of view. This is a hotel where a very large percentage of guests are seniors. There are very few children at this resort probably because the pool is 4 feet deep at the shallowest part. In the water class I had to stand on my toes to touch bottom and I am 5 ft. 4 in. Another thing that I didn't like is that everyone got so dressed up for dinner even in the buffet. I experienced a very unfriendly attitude from most of the guests treating Americans as if we were invisible. When I had previously vacationed in Punta Cana at a different resort, I enjoyed the music and entertainment at the pool. At this resort, there is no swim up bar and no music to be heard at any time around the pool except during the water aerobics. If you are going for quiet peaceful atmosphere, this is a good place to go.

reviews.title: An Objective Review
reviews.text: I would not recommend the Outback Safari to seniors with any back issues. It was a ride in the back of a truck from 9 until 5 over terrible roads filled with potholes. What we saw was interesting but the ride was very tiring and uncomfortable and the day was too long. There should be a caution on this excursion about back problems. Our guide told us that the government does not fix the roads in the country.

reviews.title: Second class resort
reviews.text: Overall I had a wonderful vacation. The positives outweighed the negatives!

reviews.title: Best Trip EVER
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 day trip to Punta Cana. Our group of 10 stayed at the RUI Palace. I cannot say enough about our rooms and service. IT was just wonderful. The hotel was very clean and inviting. Staff was great!! Especially Teo at the bar near the water. The weather was sunny and warm even though it rained just a liitle it did not spoil a moment. Food was OK, just like most reviews have stated, but we never went hungry. Can't wait to go back again.

reviews.title: Rather pay to stay home then go there again
reviews.text: Was suppsoe to be a honeymoon ya right, a peice of luggage was lost at the hotel and never found, was suppose to be in a jaquzzi suite get stuck in a standard room and they tell me the room was trashed from the people before then was told the sales department over booked. had no water oneday and the next had aunts all in my room and took the maids 2 hours to come up and clean it. Food please lived on french fries and ice cream. wife was sick everynight from the food. So i ask myself will i ever go back...NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
Let me begin by saying that we entered this vacation with a cautious eye. After reading the reviews on this website, I was more than curious about the lack of similarities between the reviews.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended
Totally Wonderful Place and Vacation at the Riu Palace
reviews.text: This was a great vacation. My wife and I spent 9 nights and 10 days in paradise. The service and resort was much more than we ever expected, especially for the price. The natives of the island were a warm and firendly people. The beach was incredible with a constant breeze to keep the heat stress down. We prefed the pool in the afternoon. The lack of many kids was great. The Bambu was crawling with the rugrats, and we were glad to have stayed at the Palace. The food was nothing to write home about. I had no problems finding things to eat, but my wife (who tends to be a little more on the picky side) wasn't as thirlled with the cuisine as I. A basic knowledge of Spanish is helpful. Rough English is spoken by most workers, but remember, you are in a Spanish speaking country. We would expect them to speak English, if they came here. Also, Jonny Bravo, of the Anamacion staff was awesome. He was a blast to be around and wasn't as crude as some of the others. Again, have no concerns if you are booking your trip. It is worth your time and money.

reviews.title: Will absolutely return next year
reviews.text: Never have my husband and I received such excellent service as at the Riu Palace, altho' we take a vacation at least once and sometimes twice a year. The attention was incredible..felt like a royal family!! The place was so beautiful and immaculate and service people were cleaning up regularly. The food was very enjoyable, altho' the beef was a bit tough, but we ate kid (very tender), and at the carving station had a whole grouper (not that we ate the whole thing!), a pig roast one night (best I ever had, including locally done), loved loved loved the pork chops. Don't know what they season them with, but they were scrumptuous. Wouldn't mind having some of their recipes...!! We did eat at the International Buffet each evening as there was such a variety to choose from that we felt we would be cheated had we only one entree!! Our waiters were so attentive and after the second day, brought me my favorite, Cappucino, as we sat down, without me even asking. The bread was great and the desserts were wonderful. and this from a woman who is basically a light eater!! Salad selections were terrific, too. They also make great pasta dishes and pizza, of which I was surprised to find pasta there. There were at least 9 stations and on Mexican night, had addt'l stations. For lunch we ate at the Caribe Grill and/or the pizzeria. Both sit on the beach by the ocean and is wonderful to have lunch and sit and take in the gorgeous sights. Breakfast was in the International Buffet and choice of food was quite varied. The beach is incredible, too. soft powdery sand, no shells or rocks to contend with, did not blow on us even during one windy day,' walking into the ocean was like walking on velvet and, except for one day when there was a storm out at sea which produced some minor seaweed, was very clear and a beautiful turqoise in color. Had perfectly beautiful weather every day, but can't say that was the Riu's doing! HaHa.

reviews.title: lots of sun
reviews.text: This was my fourth time staying at the Riu Palace and I have no complaints. I was here from 04/24 to 05/08 and it was extremely hot and no rain....bring lots of sunscreen.
The rooms are beautiful and also kept extremely clean. The maids are available at all times and even come in the evening to turn down the beds.
reviews.title: Riu Palace of Pleasure
Wonderful Spot for All Ages !!!!
reviews.text: The front desk staff (Santana and Serveno) are pleasant and very accomodating.

You can always see the dining room staff catering to all of our needs and if you have a problem you just need to ask Salvador or Montero to accomodate your request. The food is enjoyable and the drinks plentiful.
reviews.title: Awesome vacation

reviews.text: Thanks to the animation team (Johnny Bravo, Edward and Chocolate) for all the laughs. Take a scuba lesson with Enis who is here from Germany, very friendly girl.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: My Fiance and I returned from a 2 week stay at the palace (2/6 - 16/6) and i have to say that this hotel is amazing. I read a lot of reviews on this website before we left and i was unsure of what to expect. However, we were blown away by the hotel and especially by the staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Rollercoaster at the Palace
reviews.text: The staff on arrival were friendly and exlpained the various rules of the hotel, such as how to get your towels each day and when and were to eat.

reviews.title: We Loved the Riu Palace Macao
reviews.text: The room we stayed was in great condition and thankfully there was air conditioning. There is a mini bar with bottled water, soft drinks and alcohol which was restocked everyother day. They also have a safe in each room.

reviews.title: A Family trip of 14 to Riu
reviews.text: The pool is okay but we found that, because of the palm trees, there was not much breeze so it got very hot around that area. Still, its great to have the waiter come round and take your drink order whilst your soaking up the rays!

We spent most of our time on the beach, which is fantastic. The sea is clear and very clean. The only problem was you got a lot of people approaching you to try and get you to go parasailing/scuba diving etc.
reviews.title: 2nd Honeymoon above and beyond
loved it!
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I just returned after spending 10 days at this hotel. We had a wonderful time and loved the hotel! The staff was polite, helpful and friendly. Although we tipped for everything nobody expected it and they were appreciative for every tip we gave. The food was really good for an all-inclusive. Lunch and breakfast were basically the same everyday but how much can you really change these up? I did have minor stomach problems but nothing that some Pepto didn't cure.

reviews.title: Riu Place Macao..Yuck!!!!!
reviews.text: The pool was clean and did not have too many children, unlike some of the neighboring pools. Not that we don't like kids but the pool at the palace was a relaxing place to read and chill. The beach is a minute walk from the hotel and the staff was happy to help find chairs or move them if asked.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: This hotel had a really nice mix of people, although mostly from Europe (Germany, France, and Spain). It was a really pleasant and peaceful place to spend our vacation and we're so happy we went.

reviews.title: Perfect Getaway
reviews.text: While we may not go back because there are millions of other places we want to visit, we would definitely recommend it to our friends or family.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend have just returned from two weeks at this excellent hotel-the whole place is fabulous, the public areas and bars are spotlessly clean and the staff at the hotel cannot do enough for you.

reviews.title: Great place to stay but careful with food......
reviews.text: The beach is the best I have ever seen and has a lovely breeze but be careful because you do not realise how strong the sun is until it is too late!! There are three speciality restaurants as well as the main buffet restaurant which had a good choice each night-we tried the mediterranean and the steak house but weren't too impressed which was a shame.

reviews.title: beautiful hotel but.....
reviews.text: The entertainment staff did their best to keep everybody amused if you like aerobics and salsa you will be well away! Our thomson rep lisa was okay but the excusions were overpriced.

We were one of only four english couples in the hotel which was mostly americans, german and french and it was quite difficult on some occasions to be understand as the staff knew very little english-this is fine as we don't go to foreign country and expect to be spoken to in english-they also seem to appreciate you putting in some effort with the language!
reviews.title: paradise
Loved It!!
reviews.text: We left tips for the lady that cleaned out room and the mini bar man-also our waiter in the main restaurant but I got the impression that none of this was expected-even though I heard that most of the staff earn around 95 dollars a month!!

reviews.title: Absolutly awesome!!!!
reviews.text: The Palace is absolutely wonderful. Great people, beatiful beaches and excellent service. I have been there three times in 12 months and can't wait to go back again! I am pretty picky about service but I've been very impressed with the Palace. The people are genuine, frienly and will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and happy. You can also hang out in the other RIU hotels (total of three more-right next to the palace) for a livelier party- but for a fun, relaxing vacation where you can feel like a queen/king- check out the palace!!!!

reviews.title: Not that great
reviews.text: My family and I were at the Riu Palace Macau from April 13-16, 2004. It's OK, but definitely not anything special. Our room wasn't ready until 6:30pm when we checked in. The food was much too greasy and they should cover the food so flies don't sit on it. You can find better quality food at any salad bar in a deli. It has nothing to do with local tastes, we are originally from the Dominican Republic. The pool is small and the beach is just OK. Punta Cana has become way too commercialized. If you're looking for a secluded beach, you won't find it there. Also, we had specifically asked if there was a Kids' Club with entertainment for children. Their "kid's club" consists of a small area where YOU are expected to be with your child. Therefore, we spent our vacation babysitting. Definately not worth going.

reviews.title: Great time at The Palace!
reviews.text: We just got back from a four day trip to the Palace. My husbuand took me for my birthday. The Palace is a beautiful resort on a beautiful island. It is clean, the staff is very friendly and always has the patron of the resort in mind. They want you to have fun. We never saw anyone with an attitude about anything the entire time. The drinks were good, food was o.k. Not like the states but remember where you are. I think they do the best they can. The beach was awesome, the pools were fun. The clientile is mainly European. I must say there were a few obnoxious people on the beach. For the most part the Palace is a quiet resort. If you want to pick things up a little just go next door. The choice is yours. Like anything, you make it what you want it to be. If you don't have a good time here I think it is your own fault! When we first arrived we were in our room within 1/2 hour. After about 5 hours the front desk informed us that we were in a lower priced room than what we paid for and wanted to upgrade us. We declined because we were already settled in our room. They sent a bottle of champagne on ice the first night and a gift from the gift shop. The hotel manager told my husband he wanted to make sure we were satisfied because it is important to them that we were. He assured the manager we were fine and the choice not to move was ours. How much time do you spend in your room? The next night, another bottle of champagne! We will definitely go back again!

reviews.title: First Class Resort
reviews.text: My husband and I took a quick trip (4 nights) sans kids to the Palace. We read every review prior to going. I can't substantiate any of the complaints we read , maybe it was simply the spring break timing. We were there May 10-14th. The Palace was spotless, the grounds beautiful, our room was upgraded to a beautiful suite with a huge balcony complete with rockers, the service was excellent, and the staff was charming. If you could mutter a few words of spanish, it would be to your advantage!! This was our second trip to Punta Cana, so we knew the European factor was going to be there. The German and French tourists are cold, arrogant, and would prefer to look the other way rather than say Hello. Watch the buffet lines, they don't understand the word "line". To them it means jump in anywhere (in front of you) to get what they want. They don't want to wait for you, but you can wait for them!! (the food was fine, no illnesses to report and the selection was plentiful)The clientele was most definitely older, but this was fine as we are in our mid 40's, and don't look for the party places. There were people in their 70's, and a few 80's. Bottom line: the Palace is beautiful, and if we ever went back to the DR, we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Some reviewers left a hint about taking the singles, and small bills. Best advice yet. Small tips really make a difference to these people. It really made my day to give them a tip. I don't think it happens often.

reviews.title: I'm going back!
reviews.text: The Riu Palace was great. My wife and I who are both in our early 30's went for a 3 night long weekend. What we found was friendly people both guests and staff, good food-not fantastic but very good, cold drinks, plenty of sun, plenty of activities, awsome beach, nice pool, beutiful grounds and rooms. I really believe that anyone can find a reason to complain, but we found nothing to complain about the entire trip. Now if your looking for a wild party then go to Cancun. If you just want to have a relaxing vacation where everything is at your fingertips Putna Cana is for you. We spent most of our days at the Riu Bambu. They had activities geared toward a slightly younger crowd and a great swim-up bar. We met several nice couples from all over the US, Canada, France, and Germany.

aka: Riu Palace Macao Hotel Punta Cana
description: Located on Arena Gorda Beach in Punta Cana. Complimentary sun loungers on the beach. Within the Riu Resort, along with the Riu Palace Punta Cana, Riu Taino, Riu Naiboa hotels and the ClubHotel Riu Bambu. 3-storey building. Colonial style architecture. Surrounded by 30,000 m2 / 36,000 sq. yards of palm groves alongside the beach. 50 km / 31 miles from Higey. 200 m / 660 ft. from Caribbean Street. 30 km / 19 miles from Punta Cana Int'l. Airport. Credit cards accepted: Visa, MasterCard, Amex.
